title: How Many Calories in Lasagna?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in lasagna per serving, including full nutrition breakdown, macros, and variations for different recipes.
assumptions: Typical beef lasagna with layers of pasta, ground beef, tomato sauce, ricotta, mozzarella, and parmesan; one serving ≈250g baked.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, ingredients, portion size, and preparation method. Check labels or recipes for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: One serving of lasagna (about 250g) provides ~375 kcal with balanced macros from carbs, protein, and fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add extra 1 oz mozzarella per serving
Low-fat cheese and lean turkey instead of beef

faqs.q: How many calories in one serving of lasagna?
faqs.a: About 375 kcal for a standard 250g beef lasagna serving.

faqs.q: What are the macros in lasagna?

faqs.a: Yes, around 750mg per serving due to cheese and sauce.

faqs.q: How does vegetable lasagna compare in calories?
faqs.a: Typically 50-100 kcal less per serving than meat versions.

faqs.q: Does frozen lasagna have more calories?
faqs.a: Similar, but check labels—some brands add extra cheese or sauce, increasing to 400+ kcal per serving.
